description.narrative: Målet med insatsen är att förbättra utbildningskvaliteten i Albanien genom att stärka undervisningen om demokratiskt medborgarskap baserat på Europarådets standarder och praxis. Det föreslagna programmet syftar till att stötta Albanien vid implementeringen av relevanta mål från den nationella strategin för mellanstadiet och högstadiet. Ministeriet med ansvar för utbildning, sport och ungdom, regionala utbildningsdepartement, lokala självstyren och skolor (lärare, pedagoger, psykologer, rektorer) utgör ansvariga huvudaktörer. Civilsamhällesorganisationer kommer att ha en betydande roll i projekten genom att fungera som stöd för skolorna samt säkerhetsställa en förbindelse mellan skolan och samhället omkring. Rättighetsinnehavarna och de främsta förmånstagarna i projektet kommer att vara eleverna. Genom att tillämpa nationella policys och dokument om demokratiskt medborgarskap, genom att stötta antagande av en demokratisk och inkluderande styrning i skolorna och genom att stärka lärarnas kompetens samt ändra deras inställning, kommer projektet att bidra till en mer inkluderande skolmiljö för alla barn, liksom möjligheten för elever att utveckla och utöva demokratisk kunskap i klassrum, skolor och samhällen. Insatsen längd är bestämd till 48 månader (1 december 2019 till 30 november 2023). Sverige kommer att underteckna avtal med Europarådet genom att använda Europarådets mallar för projektavtal. Sidas krav på årliga revisioner ingår i utkastet till projektavtalet. Medel kommer att överföras till Europarådet och Europarådet kommer att vidarebefordra medlet till civilsamhällesorganisationer för aktiviteter relaterade till andra delen av insatsen. 14.4 % av Europarådets totala budget (1 385 600 EUR ) för insatsen, kommer att vidarebefordras till civilsamhällesorganisationer.

The goal of the intervention is to improve quality of education in Albania by strengthening democratic citizenship education based on Council of Europe standards and practices. The proposed programme aims to support Albania in the implementation of the relevant objectives of the National Strategy for Pre-university Education. Key duty-bearers are Ministry of Education, Sports and Youth, regional education departments, local self-governments, schools (teachers, pedagogues, psychologists, managers). Civil society organisations will play an important role in the project by supporting the schools and ensuring the link between schools and their wider communities.
Key right holders and the main beneficiary of the project will be the school students. By enhancing national policies and documents on citizenship education, by supporting the adoption of democratic and inclusive school governance in schools and by strengthening teachers’ professional competences and changing their attitudes, the project will help create a more inclusive and enabling school environment for all children, as well as more opportunities for students to develop democratic competences and to exercise these in their classrooms, schools and communities.
The intervention duration is 48 months. About 14,4 % of the total budget (1 385 600 EUR) will be forwarded to civil society organisations.

The goal of the intervention is to improve quality of education in Albania by strengthening democratic citizenship education based on CoE standards and practices. Intermediate outcome is the following: The capacity of the Albanian education system to develop learners’ competences for a democratic culture, in line with national policy objectives and CoE instruments and approaches, is strengthened. Immediate outcomes are: 1. (Policy support) The policy and methodological framework on democratic citizenship education and the democratic governance of schools are aligned to key national education objectives and the Council of Europe standards and approaches. 2. (Democratic school governance) School children in selected schools are provided with the skills, knowledge and opportunities to participate in the decision-making processes in their schools and communities and engage in school and community-based projects jointly with civil society organisations. 3. (Teacher support) Teachers develop new professional competences, practices and attitudes that better contribute to the development of competences for democratic culture in learners and ensure an inclusive and enabling learning environment for all children.

description.narrative:
During 2020, the following results were achieved:
- A comprehensive review of education for democratic citizenship in pre-university education in Albania was carried out. The preliminary results were presented and further discussed during 4 online round-tables, bringing together 50 major education stakeholders. Policy and practice recommendations aiming to cumulatively enhance the capacity of the formal education system to develop competences for a democratic culture in school children were endorsed by the Ministry of Education, Sports and Youth.
- The first 25 pilot schools were selected through a competitive and open procedure out of 79 applications.
- A Teacher Network consisting of 125 teachers from the first cohort of 25 pilot schools was established in December 2020. Among other support, teachers will have the opportunity to access Council of Europe online courses. Some of the courses, starting with Key Course on Competences for Democratic Culture, will be translated into Albanian. The teachers and wider school community will also have the opportunity to participate in a series of webinars with focus on practice-oriented teaching promoting citizenship, democracy, and human rights.
- As a response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the project also adapted and translated into Albanian the publication, Teaching Competences for democratic culture online, and Council of Europe´s Digital Citizenship Handbook and offered in local language several digital lessons plan aimed to facilitate discussions on issues related to pandemic with learners.
